metadata.title: CVE-2020-5504 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In phpMyAdmin 4 before 4.9.4 and 5 before 5.0.1, SQL injection exists inthe user accounts page. A malicious user could inject custom SQL in placeof their own username when creating queries to this page. An attacker musthave a valid MySQL account to access the server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-5504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.9.5+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.5+dfsg1-2').
